worst_case_scenario: Only counting kinetic energy (acceleration) and uphill climbing, ignoring downhill recovery benefits

power_data.power_notes: Full power meter data available. Represents elite amateur race intensity.

normalized_power_impact.methodology_note: NP estimated from power distribution and KE acceleration pattern. Average is lower than NP due to flat course with steady speed.

time_impact_estimation.explanation: At 2% extra power requirement, rider must either go 2% slower or expend 2% more effort. Over 62 minutes, this compounds to ~1 minute 8 seconds loss.

summary.practical_impact: Minor but noticeable at the margin. In a close race decided by 30-60 seconds, 1kg could be the difference.

power_data.power_notes: Complete power meter recording. Measured data used for calculations.

normalized_power_impact.methodology_note: Based on actual measured power distribution from power meter. NP calculated using fourth power mean formula.

time_impact_estimation.explanation: At 1.69% extra power requirement over 56 minutes, approximately 1 minute time loss. In competitive criterium racing, this is significant.

summary.practical_impact: In a race with ~220W average power, an extra 3.7W is noticeable but manageable for fit amateurs. At NP of 264W, +5.7W is a 2.2% penalty.
summary.performance_context: Your peak power of 593W is strong - focus on maintaining sprint power rather than worrying about 1kg.

flat_criteriums_pattern.key_insight: At your power level (220-240W average), 1kg costs ~1.7-2% in power. On flats, this is dominated by acceleration demand.

vs_climbing_races.note: Data from Dawlish and Hillingdon not yet analyzed
vs_climbing_races.expected_pattern: On climbing routes, PE term dominates. Expect 60-150 MJ (vs 12-16 for flats)
vs_climbing_races.expected_time_loss: 2-5 minutes per race (dramatically worse than flats)

optimization_priority.rank_1: Climbing races - weight matters MOST here
optimization_priority.rank_2: Hilly courses with short sharp climbs
optimization_priority.rank_4: Flat criteriums - YOUR focus (least weight sensitive)
optimization_priority.rank_5: Sprint distances (pure power, weight 10x less important)
